annotation.text: These Western blot analyses provided evidence of association between the N terminus of AC8 and both human AKAP79-HA and its rat orthologue AKAP150-HA (Fig. 1A, lane 2).

Interestingly, AKAP150-HA was also shown to interact with the C terminus of AC8 (Fig. 1A, lane 4), although there was no evidence of AKAP79-HA interaction with this domain, suggesting differences in the specific interactions between these two AKAP orthologues and AC8.

annotation.infon: positive regulation of adenylate cyclase activity|GO:0045762
annotation.text: Interestingly, expression of AKAP150-HA potentiated the degree of Ca2+-stimulated AC8 activity (p < 0.05).

annotation.infon: negative regulation of adenylate cyclase activity|GO:0007194
annotation.text: In MIN6 cells transiently transfected with AKAP150-HA, the amplitude of Ca2+-stimulated cAMP production was reduced (Fig. 7, B and C).

annotation.infon: negative regulation of adenylate cyclase activity|GO:0007194
annotation.text: This effect of AKAP150 overexpression is again consistent with the attenuating effects of AKAP79 on AC8 activity in HEK293 cells and of AKAP150 on AC8 activity in MIN6 cells, which suggests that AKAP79/150 dampens Ca2+-dependent AC8 activity as a consequence of its interaction with the enzyme.
